net.gotev.uploadservice

Class BinaryUploadRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gotev.uploadservice.HttpUploadRequest
      • net.gotev.uploadservice.BinaryUploadRequest

  • public class BinaryUploadRequest
extends HttpUploadRequest
    Binary file upload request. The binary upload uses a single file as the raw body of the upload request.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryUploadRequest(Context context, String serverUrl)
      Creates a new binaryupload request and automatically generates an upload id, that will be returned when you call HttpUploadRequest.startUpload().
      BinaryUploadRequest(Context context, String uploadId, String serverUrl)
      Creates a binary file upload request.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BinaryUploadRequest

        public BinaryUploadRequest(Context context,
                           String uploadId,
                           String serverUrl)
        Creates a binary file upload request.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        uploadId - unique ID to assign to this upload request.
        It can be whatever string you want, as long as it's unique. If you set it to null or an empty string, an UUID will be automatically generated.
        It's advised to keep a reference to it in your code, so when you receive status updates in UploadServiceBroadcastReceiver, you know to which upload they refer to.
        serverUrl - URL of the server side script that will handle the multipart form upload. E.g.: http://www.yourcompany.com/your/script

      • BinaryUploadRequest

        public BinaryUploadRequest(Context context,
                           String serverUrl)
        Creates a new binaryupload request and automatically generates an upload id, that will be returned when you call HttpUploadRequest.startUpload().
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        serverUrl - URL of the server side script that will handle the multipart form upload. E.g.: http://www.yourcompany.com/your/script

                                    throws FileNotFoundException
        Sets the file used as raw body of the upload request.
        Parameters:
        path - Absolute path to the file that you want to upload
        Returns:
        BinaryUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file to upload does not exist

      • setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload

        public BinaryUploadRequest setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload(boolean autoDeleteFiles)
        Description copied from class: HttpUploadRequest
        Sets the automatic file deletion after successful upload.
        Overrides:
        setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload in class HttpUploadRequest
        Parameters:
        autoDeleteFiles - true to auto delete files included in the request when the upload is completed successfully. By default this setting is set to false, and nothing gets deleted.
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

      • setCustomUserAgent

        public BinaryUploadRequest setCustomUserAgent(String customUserAgent)
        Description copied from class: HttpUploadRequest
        Sets the custom user agent to use for this upload request. Note! If you set the "User-Agent" header by using the "addHeader" method, that setting will be overwritten by the value set with this method.
        Overrides:
        setCustomUserAgent in class HttpUploadRequest
        Parameters:
        customUserAgent - custom user agent string
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

      • setUsesFixedLengthStreamingMode

        public BinaryUploadRequest setUsesFixedLengthStreamingMode(boolean fixedLength)
        Description copied from class: HttpUploadRequest
        Sets if this upload request is using fixed length streaming mode. If it uses fixed length streaming mode, then the value returned by HttpUploadTask.getBodyLength() will be automatically used to properly set the underlying HttpURLConnection, otherwise chunked streaming mode will be used.
        Overrides:
        setUsesFixedLengthStreamingMode in class HttpUploadRequest
        Parameters:
        fixedLength - true to use fixed length streaming mode (this is the default setting) or false to use chunked streaming mode.
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest
